website_summaries.verdict: Though it offers impressive range, the poor construction and inability to withstand wind are major issues to consider.
pros: Stands out for its ability to pick up stations up to 150 miles away and deliver good reception in most areas
cons: The build isn't very durable, and any slight damage results in reduced range and reception
Sensitive to mildly windy conditions, also resulting in reception interference

customer_reviews.title: which wasn't as good as the Radio Shack antenna we put up there ...
customer_reviews.text: I took this up to Upper Michigan this summer thinking it would improve the antenna I have on the house. The stations are at least 80 miles away. The remote rotation works, but you have no idea what direction the antenna is pointing without physically looking at it. I didn't mount it on the roof outside as the roof is a 12/12 pitch and didn't have ladders to safely get up there. I did mount it in the attic, which wasn't as good as the Radio Shack antenna we put up there when they were changing to digital. The worst part was couldn't see the direction it was pointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jim W

customer_reviews.title: Very good unit
customer_reviews.text: Very solid antenna. It seems to have improved the reception problems I was having. Be aware that when you open the box, the installation might look a little daunting, but it is very simple for anyone who can use a screwdriver. Documentation isn't particularly clear, but of course it isn't very complicated to figure out. I easily mounted mine on a 3/4" galvanized pipe screwed into a floor flange mounted to a crossbeam in my garage. Cheaper than buying an official mounting pole.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: It's on a shelf in my garage, in case someone else wants it. I have an 80 mile omni-directional antenna that picks up 40 channels, this one picked up 9. I realize it's directional, but when I placed it facing the direction I wanted to receive from, it still failed to perform to the level of the 80 mile omni-directional. So I ended up taking it back down and sticking with the omni directional. It was missing some screws for assembly as well. Wasn't happy with the purchase and boxing it up is too difficult to return.
customer_reviews.author: R Waters

customer_reviews.title: Effectiveness of Booster Degraded In Two Days
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy when I first set this antenna up. I had a huge old style antenna that brought in about 34 local channels. The first day I installed this new antenna I got 38 channels. After a couple days the number dropped off to about 30. I checked direction and cable connections, with no improvement. I've been busy so it's been 5 months since installing, quality of signal has continued to degrade. I thought this had a one year warranty, but Amazon says my service has run out on this product. Too bad
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of garbage! I should have listened to the one star ...
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of garbage! I should have listened to the one star reviewers and passed over this piece of crap! It is made out of very cheap looking plastic and there is a lot of play in the motor attached head. I doubt it would last very long at all, a good windstorm would blow it apart. Anyway, I installed it on my roof and it did work fine for about 2 months and then it started dropping channels. Channels would fade in and out and pixelate constantly. I took it down, threw it in the trash and installed the RCA ANT751 antenna instead. It works perfectly and is made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Best engineering job I've seen in 20 years. - Engineers against Hard
customer_reviews.text: So far review. First I got my antenna in record time - one day. Not bad. This is an incredibly well designed package. I've been working with Ham antennas along with military antennas for years. This product exhibits some great enginuity. The idea of using plastic as a structural form, then lining it with lighter metals is genius. You could make any profile in this manner at a very low cost. It went together precisely. Everything slide together well, all holes were predrilled with precision for good power gain on radio signals. So far great, tomorrow, we get it up on the roof and will tell you just how much power this puppy really has. Great job ViewTV. Doug
customer_reviews.author: Doug Felsenthal

customer_reviews.title: This thing works good. When it arrived I was not impressed as ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing works good. When it arrived I was not impressed as it is small and very cheap plastic and super thin aluminum.. I actually did not expect it to work well because it is so small and cheaply made but I was wrong. It pulls in 18 stations where the old "large" analog antenna pulled in 2. We are about 100 miles away from the stations so it most definitely works. Personally I would do away with the mechanical rotor part and put some of that money into making it a little sturdier. As others have said it must be connected to the "control box" for the signal to pass through.
customer_reviews.author: Jack G. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Very unhappy
customer_reviews.text: This is a bad purchase and if I hadn't thrown the box away I'd return it. Had better luck with a cheap $10 antenna inside that picked up twice as many channels. Do not buy this item. I'm 20-50 miles between 4 transmitters and only get 10 channels. With my cheap one I had right at 20. I have it hooked up properly and the antenna doesn't turn as it is supposed to with the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution for TV Problems!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the View TV Outdoor Antenna. My order arrived promptly in perfect condition and was easily assembled with a screwdriver. Fortunately, I had a thirty foot pole already in place so it was easy to mount the new antenna and rotator. Once installed, a few tweaks with the remote control to find time the antenna direction and everything worked perfectly. I can now receive the CBS station just as clearly through the air as I could with my satellite service before the contract battle with the local CBS station removed them from the DirecTV service. I am amazed at the effectiveness of such a small antenna. I consider this product to be AAA ratedI
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Biegler

customer_reviews.title: This is it. This is finally the one. ...
customer_reviews.text: This is it. This is finally the one. This is the affordable antenna that has given us watchable, free TV after we cut the cable. We are now saving $90 a month (exorbitant rural pricing) and able to watch network television again. We hung it in the attic rather than mounting it outside. But even the first test with it sitting on the floor in the living room we picked up all the major stations.
customer_reviews.author: Dan or Janie

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane Irma! Anyone saying anything negative about this item is crazy!
customer_reviews.text: I don't write a lot of reviews but this thing blew me away, literally. I set it up a day before hurricane Irma here in Naples, FL. It survived 100+mph winds flawlessly. Obviously I mounted it well but structurally it survived the winds and continues to work great! Anyone saying anything negative about this item either installed it wrong or is flat out lying! Great item! Great price and it qualifies as hurricane resistant. BIG PLUS in my book!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Mango

customer_reviews.title: Far Cheaper than Cable
customer_reviews.text: This is about my 4th antenna of this nature I have had in 7 years. They last about two years in the rain, wind, hail, snow, etc and then they begin to have issues and are so easy and inexpensive, replacement is the easy answer. In this instance, had a lightening strike very near the antenna and apparently fouled the insides in some way and when I replaced the antenna, my television 32 channels were instantly replaced. Note, the closest transmitter is about 40-60 miles away and this system works great, make sure it is pointed in the right direction.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Forwood

customer_reviews.title: The until was easy to assemble and install in my attic
customer_reviews.text: I'm in the process of cutting my cable, so I needed a digital antenna for local broadcast TV. The ViewTV unit works very well by pulling in 38 channel from the Philadelphia area (~35 miles away). I'm also getting channels from Reading and Allentown, PA (~55 miles). The until was easy to assemble and install in my attic. My only issue is that one major local TV station, 6ABC (WPVI digital VHF on Channel 6), is not found when either of my two TVs do channel scans. I'm not sure if this is a function of the antenna or some interference. I'm still working on the problem, but the rest of the channels work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: ... sattelite subscription programming to appreciate this antennae and those like it. If your tired of paying 100 bucks ...
customer_reviews.text: One only need to be free from cable and or sattelite subscription programming to appreciate this antennae and those like it. If your tired of paying 100 bucks a month for endless commercials and infomercials then you will like this item. The antennae works well so far. It rotates as advertised. Im getting about 36 channels including HSN AND QVC for my area. Yes I still see commercials. Yes there is occasional signal drop. Yes there is some HD programming. There is no monthly bill. There are DVRs available if you want to record shows while your away.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Workman

customer_reviews.title: Returned as it's just cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.text: I'm under a mountain shadow for half of our local OTA channels, so I thought it might be worth a try to put this on the roof since it's supposed to be more powerful than the leaf style antennas. Even though it looks like it's all nice aluminum or steel, it's actually mostly cheap plastic. And the signal booster is not that powerful. So don't expect it to live too long on your roof, nor do I suspect it to help you get a better signal than the basic leaf style antennas. If you want to give the roof antenna thing a try you're better off spending a bit more for something sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: BS AZ

customer_reviews.title: Replaced old antenna and am now thowing this in the garbage
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older stationary antenna that had good signal except for one local station and so I thought I would go with this antenna with the "150" mile range. I replaced the antenna with this one and the motor never worked. I had to manually adjust the antenna and it never gave the signal strength as my old antenna. My old antenna had a 50 mile range but with this antenna LOST channels. So much for the "150 mile" range. It is going into the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen A

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We got rid of satellite 2 years ago. This antenna along with rokus and internet allows for much better tv viewing options at a small fraction of the cost. We get 10-12 channels which includes our local news. We didn't love the idea of puncturing our roof to mount so we have ours on a post outside. It also allows for easy access if we get snow on the antenna. This is our 2nd one since our first was smashed from an extreme wind storm however many people had damage from that storm. It's not necessarily a problem with the antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviews and an expert assessment, all of which said this antenna is great. I agree. Easy to install and it found all the local channels, with excellent quality picture and sound. The only reason I took off one star is because the instructions are minimal and do not have any information on how to use the rotator. It was easy enough to figure out, and the rotator did work, but better instructions would be an improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Where to point.  Instructions Great.
customer_reviews.text: Product great actually works. Easy set up. Insure when you set up that you have an unobstructed line of sight to horizon when pointing HD Antenna. Sometimes atmospheric anomaly's and or trees during summer may interfere with signal which is expected on occasion. Easy set up in that after I made all of the connections and guessed where I should point the antenna I have a setting on my VIZIO television which auto searches for signals and wound up with 5 channels that broadcast in the New York Area. Since I am approximately 45 miles from New York City to the North North East. All worked out better than expected. Great Product.
customer_reviews.author: Frank X. Cassella

customer_reviews.title: Your limited to what size diameter pole you can use, dont remember what size now.
customer_reviews.text: Im not sure its a 150 mile range might be in the perfect flat world, it all matters weather, and interference,elevation, and how strong the stations broadcast signal is , and how high you mount your antenna. I am very happy with it, the closest broadcasting signal is 48 miles away with a little tuning we pick up the stations, and the other direction we can pick up stations 90 miles away. The picture is great on the channels we get. So far it has stood up to 2 storms with 70mph winds, even if we have to replace it every couple of years the price is right, its a whole lot better than paying stupid satellite tv rates
customer_reviews.author: Hello There

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, for more remote area, 60 to 80 miles, flat area. Florida East Coast.
customer_reviews.text: Works Great, for more remote area. Palm Coast, Florida is 60 to 80 miles from Jacksonville, Fl.. This Antenna says good for up to 150 miles not too sure about that, but works good for us at max of maybe 80 miles. There are web sites that will tell you if you live close enough to near enough to HD Broadcast Ants., says we are to far away, but this one works were others didn't. Cost was very competitive with the lesser ants. what wouldn't work. For mast from Ground, with hole for stability and strength. I used two 10' lengths of iron with pipe, 1, 1"-- 1, 3/4" with 1' to 3/4" Union. Ant. screwed together with pipe perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Denis C. Logan

customer_reviews.title: Works very well up to about 65 miles
customer_reviews.text: After installation, it is very challenging to dial it in perfectly to get the stations I was trying to about 65 miles away. This is likely due to a cell tower close by in my line of sight and a low mounting point on my home. I will say do not give up on it, and even using the phone compass can be a pain, so try to have an analog compass handy to really dial it in. Once it is dialed in, the reception is amazing. I went from picking up 10 channels with an amplified antenna in my attic to 33 from this. Be very patient with it and it will reward you.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 2 months. Then nothing..
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for about 2 months . One night I turned on the TV to watch it and no picture.. Went outside and no red light on the antenna. The power supply was on and lit up. Never worked again! Not happy . I put up the old Channel Master antenna and it worked better anyways..
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H.

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend It makes a good back up to our satellite ...
customer_reviews.text: The antenna does it job, we live between three markets and can pull stations from each (Cincinnati, Columbus, Lexington) depending on the direction of the antenna. I don't know if it lives up to the 150 mile claims but it does pull 70+ miles from these. Would recommend It makes a good back up to our satellite (and a way to get local stations) (only negative it does seem a little cheap light metal/plastic do not know how well it would hold up in some of the high winds (if placed outside) we get but this is in the attic.
customer_reviews.author: Michael william Jones

customer_reviews.title: Money Well Spent...
customer_reviews.text: Though the materials feels a little fragile and light weight, it does really work well...I have it installed inside the house for now due to a heavy rain but I’ve already picked up 26 channel, just imagine having this antenna installed outside. This is by far the best antenna I’ve ever own and I’ve owned plenty of antennas before. I seriously like this antenna and would buy again if ever. I wish I found this a long time ago. Definitely recommend this to others who are still thinking twice. My only suggestion is, be careful with with the assembly and handling it.
customer_reviews.author: Erwin Samson

customer_reviews.title: Great for TWO TV's only
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to put together. Picks up stuff I never knew was out there. ONE BAD THING. You can only hook up two TV's to it. It has an output on the box for your 2nd TV. I tried tapping in the line to add my 2nd TV. When I did that both TV's lost stations. Hooked it up with 2nd TV coming from the box as it states to do and all was fine. One would think its a antenna, you can hook as many TV's as you like in the line. Sorry don't work that way. But all in all, it's works great for two TV's when hooked up right.....
customer_reviews.author: Lanny Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Amazing reception!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this antenna to have as a back-up when internet service is down or such events. Simple to assemble. Can't speak to the durability since it's new and it does seem rather light weight but I guess it depends on the conditions it's put into. We tested it by just putting on top of wardrobe in the bedroom and hooking it up.......scanned for channels.......and amazingly it bought in 66 channels!! Granted we are in a metropolitan area but we were shocked and the quality of picture of those 10 or so stations that we've checked out is very very good. Definitely a great little addition to our viewing options!
customer_reviews.author: George Brown

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this. I have a $8 set top antenna in my kitchen tv, it gets 15 channels. I bought this, mounted it on my roof, ran all the cables, etc. it gets 8 channels. It does NOT rotate as it is supposed to. It's very cheaply made. I'm sure it'll be laying in the yard after the first strong wind. They don't even give you an inline surge arrest fitting, so you can fry your $1500 tv if you don't know to add one. It might get more channels, if the rotate feature worked, but it does not.
customer_reviews.author: BC2J

customer_reviews.title: Great company to deal with.
customer_reviews.text: This review is more for the company than the product. The antenna worked great when in the room I had the tv. I believe that the issue was really my home. When I installed it in my attic I did not get a signal. It was going through a lot of concrete. The company sent out a whole new unit and told me to keep the original. They told me if I had any issues they would refund me all my money. The 2nd unit worked the same as the first. I am not asking for a refund. I do believe the issue is with my home and not the unit.I would not hesitate to purchase from this company again!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph H.

customer_reviews.title: free tv
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and to install, works pretty good, my old one faded out on cloudy days(it was a 80 mile range antenna) this one says much stronger, but still weak in clouds, overall working ok for now, not sure how long it will last, it is plastic and the lead in cable is not high quality, so I expect a year or two. I would recommend based on the performance so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: We couldn't be happier. We're getting rid of cable and this helps a bit (along with RPi, Netflix, and Amazon Video.). It gets us 67 channels, and we're in the middle of nowhere. I only wish the antenna would bluetooth to the amplifier box which would in turn bluetooth to each tv with a coax dongle... so I wouldn't have had to mess with cables. At about $35 I really didn't expect much, but for the price and quality this is an amazing deal. On our 4k and 2k TVs it's easy to see that the quality of the picture is actually better than our cable service.
customer_reviews.author: VG Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: parts missing
customer_reviews.text: we have no idea how this works yet as the the screws to put it together weren't in the package and my husband has to go find the teeny tiny screws today. hooked it up today to one tv. after my husband was able to find screws to fit. we have attic installation so we didn't expect 150 mi range and we didn't get it but we have enough to satisfy us and cut the satellite dish off. only all of our so called local stations( we are 50 miles away at least from all) came in except the cbs station. . its transmitter is probably in the same place as the others.
customer_reviews.author: JKW

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED Review 3/2019
customer_reviews.text: After using this antenna for a while I decided to update my review. I was not thrilled with quality when I received this antenna, but it was easy to assemble and INITIALLY it appeared to work fine. I installed the antenna outside on an old tower next to the house. The longer it is up, the worse things are getting. It does not do well with wind, or rain. I have constant pixelating on my TV. I noticed today that it was pointing more east, thus it is not staying tight on the pole. Going to find one more wind resistant.
customer_reviews.author: K. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and quality! ******
customer_reviews.text: Great Packaging, excellent simple instructions. Set up was very easy, I am still trying many configurations, but I am able to pull in signals from Boston, Springfield, Hartford, Providence, Manchester, and Portsmouth, Portland ME. I don't even have it outside. I have a great interior view and hidden spot. I did initially have issues near my chimney as it is lead lined in my old house. Love it works great! I'll follow up with more after I try my Dish Network set up. Which will be slightly more challenging, Straight to TV and DVR it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Lasse143

customer_reviews.title: Working fine Oakland
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. while installing the antenna dropped into the dirt as I mounted it to a broom stick ... and a plastic fin broke off as did the unit fin-unit from the main body of the antenna. Duck tape put all of it together again ... I think it will work. The materials are cheep solid plastic... however the antenna is doing it's job. Just don't drop it. As long as nothing is going to hit it or you drop it, then the antenna does it's job just fine. Low cost = potential durability issue, but it is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: W. B.

customer_reviews.title: No More Cable!!
customer_reviews.text: Have to say it seems to be working great I installed it on the roof on my existing DirecTV mount. I didn't use the hook up the motorized portion and I don't seem to need it. I get all my stations and they come in crystal clear. Sometimes NBC gets a little weird but I think that is on their end as 90% of the time it comes in great and all the other stations have no issues. I would say I love it except for the lack of a pole to use to mount it, I mean really how much could that really cost to add to the bundle?
customer_reviews.author: E. Conroy

customer_reviews.title: Works well, very good seller!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice antenna kit - easy to set up (once you get up to where you want to mount it). Be sure and get a pole/mast mounting kit, as you'll need it for optimal signal reception. The seller is very responsive. I had a problem with the control unit - it just stopped working. After verifying the power supply/wall wart was good, I contacted the seller, who promptly communicated, and shipped a replacement control unit. So far the new unit is working fine, and I'm pleased with my purchase. I can pick up about 20 OTA stations, which is good here in the Birmingham Alabama area.
customer_reviews.author: C. Granger

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my inlaws. They live in a retirement community and have direct TV here in FL where it rains every day. That was the first issue. The second is they don't like to watch the same things. I got the this antenna for them for their second TV in bedroom and I was really surprised at the quality of reception of the channels. They live in Zephyrhills FL and they were getting channels from Orlando with no problems. The TV scanned and picked up and average of around thirty channels I think. Make your life easier and order the antenna mount at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Galarza

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't pick up any channels that I didn't get with my flat antenna I had hanging in the window. The remote turning feature is useless as you ever have any idea of which direction. It's turning or where it's facing. Overall it's a very flimsy Chinese made plastic antenna that doesn't pick up any more channels than a $10 flat antenna. Look elsewhere, don't buy this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good. It's about 60 miles to the stations we watch and it picks them up fine most of the time. About the same time every morning it gets funky for 15 or 20 min.s. Don't understand that. The sound also doesn't cotton with our TV somehow. So I ran it through the stereo and that works fine... it's better sound through the stereo than it would be through the TV, but it's also something else we have to fool with. Took the dish part off and mounted it on the old Dish pole on the roof. Overall, good way to watch broadcast network channels for free.
customer_reviews.author: J. Melton

customer_reviews.title: ... in over 30 channels for me which is a great improvement over the 6 channels received by the 60 ...
customer_reviews.text: This antenna pulled in over 30 channels for me which is a great improvement over the 6 channels received by the 60 mile indoor antenna. I am approximately 50 miles and behind a few large trees from most local broadcasting locations. My reception at first was slightly glitchy on some channels before I purchased a long section of electrical conduit to increase the height to about 10 feet above my roof (30 feet above the ground). The rotating feature worked the first time I tried it but hasn't worked since that first time.
customer_reviews.author: LabraDane

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I went from 4 channels to 40! I live 35 miles south of DC and bout a few other antennas for about the same price most of them only got the the 4 the I got with rabbit ears. This came yesterday and I got 10 channels just with it sitting on the floor next to the tv, I then put it in my attic and got 28, used the rotor and got 40. I installed it to use the cable wires that were already in my home and it works fine. Eventually I will try to see what channels I can get when I turn it towards Delaware or Richmond. I am very happy with this
customer_reviews.author: Tim D.

customer_reviews.title: EZ install & very good picture resolution
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed - this animal works! I gave it FOUR stars because it seems flimsy and many components are made from what appears to be cheap plastic and that will probably impact the products longevity outdoors. The installation was easy and in minutes I was using the gear. I was using an amplified antenna previously and when I swapped it out for this guy, there was an increase in not only the number of channels available, but also the overall picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at how well it worked. Installed in the attic using a scrap piece of 3/4 pvc pipe, fit perfect, just screwed it to the roof joist. Aimed it toward the towers located above santa barbara and ran the scan on the TV and got 28 channels basically the ones you get with basic cable and it only cost $35! The remote was a bit cheap but I only used it to program my universal remote and mounted the antenna receiver in the rack with the rest of the equipment that receives the signal from the IR repeater so there is no evidence I have an antenna system at all. Very clean way to go.
customer_reviews.author: michael mete

customer_reviews.title: Great For attic use
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I purchased, this one i for a Christmas gift. I have mine mounted in my attic. I live 50 miles west of Orlando. Being able to adjust direction, I am able to pick up stations from Tampa, St. Pete. & Orlando areas. Range is very good. My antenna is used in the entire house, through the opposite type junction block that the cable company uses. The picture quality to very good, depending on the signal received. Some times is pix-elates, sometimes you will loose signal. It's not the antennas fault.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Salzberg

customer_reviews.title: Now I see everything.
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this on my roof and my goodness can I pick up a lot of channels. I live Northwest of Orlando and can even pick up Tampa channels (60 - 80 miles away). It even helped a ton before I mounted it and just had it assembled in my living room, so attic mounting will be perfect for those of you who have antenna restrictions due to an HOA. If you live 25+ miles from the transmitters, then I highly recommend this wonderful antenna. Just make sure you follow the instructions for best performance.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Apopka

customer_reviews.title: WOW! This one really works!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a two-year old RCA yagi antenna with this models and cannot believe the difference. before I received most channels but CBS was touch-and-go as was PBS. After assembling and installing this took about an hour all channels in my local area over a hundred and forty of them come in crystal clear without any adjustment necessary. The unit is pretty much plastic and I'm not sure how long it will hold up but I'm pleasantly surprised at this moment. I live in Orange County California South County and use the TiVo OTA bolt as my DVR with a mini DVR in the bedroom connected through MoCA all works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Drew M.

customer_reviews.title: good alternative to cable and dish
customer_reviews.text: We get about 30 channels here, about 70 mile from the broadcast site, but you only pay once. If you don't need hundreds of channels (I can only watch one at a time) and you have better things to do with your life than watch TV and you have better things to spend your money on than this is the way to go. I only gave it four stars because I don't think it would hold up out of doors, lots of plastic. I have mine in the attic and once you find the "sweet spot" the reception is pretty good and the picture is clear.
customer_reviews.author: GLG

customer_reviews.title: Antenna works great, excellent range
customer_reviews.text: Antenna works great, excellent range. Superb customer service... my antenna was mounted 60 feet from where the control box was located and the antenna came with 40' of coax. I connected additional coax and the antenna motor and booster did not work. I called the company (evidently when they were closed. They returned my call immediately once they opened and told me I need to use R59 coax, not R6. They offered to send the correct cable, but I used my own and it all works great with 100+ mile range.
customer_reviews.author: rkj

customer_reviews.title: its simple-install
customer_reviews.text: I had bought one of these antennas yearsago,n installed-rear of my motorhome.I recently sold my rv,n bought another motorhome.I purchased another [verysame antenna],n installed- my new motorhome.I don't receive many channels,while in the mtns,but love the reception otherwise.In Florida i been pulling 40+ channels,n they are crystal clear,without bleepn in n out.I am totally satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: barry l renno

customer_reviews.title: Better off without it
customer_reviews.text: This is no better than their little flat antenna. Very poor quality and the rotor works only when it wants to and then you have no control of which direction it turns. You can build a hoverman antenna from scrap and coat hangers and get equal reception. If you are handy and have an hour of free time look up Gray-Hoverman antenna. The plans to build it are free and it works fine even for HDTV. I built mine and only invested about $2.85.
customer_reviews.author: My own

customer_reviews.title: for the money its great....
customer_reviews.text: my old antenna quit working because a sports field 2 miles north of me installed 20 80' grounded metal liting poles and my signal went from great to nothing in summer of 2017. so I went back to cable and they finally gouged me the "last" time and I saw this antenna. I set it up two weeks ago and now get all my old antenna channels and have reset up my channel master DVR and am getting ready to ditch my cable TV except for internet. I'll save $95/mo. happy so far...
customer_reviews.author: Mark W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Finally an antenna that works
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm happy with the product. It picks up over 60 stations here that are about 50 miles from me. I had tried two previous antennas that had a 50 mile range with no luck. I mounted this one in my attic and ran the controller to my basement. From there it splits and goes to all the jacks in my house. Picture quality looks great and very easy to put together and install. Hopefully it lasts a while with no issues. I don't use the motor feature as it's not needed but not having to go into the attic to adjust it is something I like to know just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: oK, (good) TV without cost
customer_reviews.text: Allows for TV entertainment and news without having to purchase more channels than a person can watch in a day without the upward cost of dish type channels. Additional Info: I have degraded my rating for this product. After having it for a year, wind juggled the positioning. Trying to adjust for "signal" receipt is a very tricky issue. The Antenna moves way too fast and it is not possible to determine which direction it is rotating from the remote. I would suggest a stand alone antenna that you need to adjust manually as opposed to a motorized antenna. I am very disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy J Heitz

customer_reviews.title: Antenna
customer_reviews.text: We use it in the bedroom and with the 1st channel scan we picked up 91 channels. He has not mounted it outside yet 10/03/2020, it is still sitting in the corner of the bedroom buy the window, we do get a nice clear picture.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Definitely works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This antenna works very well. We are in Nevada City which is about 60 air miles from the towers in Sacramento. The terrain is mountainous but the signal is over 70% for every channel. We are getting 26 channels strongly without having to move the direction of the antenna. fooltv.com says the towers are not all in a line, but the antenna gives a wide enough capture to get them all. The picture would still be good at 40 to 50 % so I am sure it would work farther out from the towers.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Watson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Do not split signal at the power port.
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking of canceling cable/satellite services, this is the antenna to get, simple assembly and light to bring up to the roof of the house, line of sight is not rocket science, place it facing anywhere and then use the remote to point to where the towers are, scan with the TV set for channels and Preston, you start watching OTA hdtv.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with the unit.
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with the unit. I live in Las Vegas. Most of our stations transmit from a mountain in Henderson. It made adjusting easy. Haven't needed to use the rotor. I have a very large array on the peak of my house that catches all the winds. (We have a lot of Wind). This unit outperforms the larger more expensive antenna. I'm pleased with the 54 channels it pulls in. ( About 20 of them are Spanish of course). I think I'm going to replace the expensive unit with another one of these. I must admit the antenna isn't the sturdy material of the more expensive but I say the proof is in the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Fast Fred

customer_reviews.title: Super Product, Super Price, I'm done paying for TV service!
customer_reviews.text: This antenna ROCKS! The $36 cost is NOTHING compared to a monthly savings of $100+ for cable that I hardly watch. Easy assembly. At this point, 40+ channels of HD TV. Crystal clear. I put it up in the attic too. Read the reviews, this antenna has very high feedback. And it's fairly small. I almost bought the "Free TV" antenna, and then did my homework. This one is far more superior. Honestly, I can't see someone NOT happy about this antenna. Don't let the cable companies steal your money.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Casey    S.W. Florida

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in march of 2016 and less then 6 months later had issues with cord becoming loose. I emailed the seller as it was still under warranty and was sent a replacement item and now its 6-9 months later and we are having the same issues, we never us the 360 rotation only when we first set it up. My in-law bought a different antenna at the same time we purchased our first antenna and it was about double to price of this one but they are having no issues with theirs, so i guess spending more is worth it if you don't have to spend 35-40 dollars each year on a new antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this antenna since late December of 2016, cancelled cable the end of January 2017. It has 2 outputs from the supplied amplifier, one is split to feed the 2 primary TVs in the house and the other feeds 3. Great picture quality on all my local channels with all TVs attached to it. Mounted in my 2nd story attic so I didn't have to run any cables externally.
customer_reviews.author: Dave011182

customer_reviews.title: TV like it should be
customer_reviews.text: We have cut out satellite service since it keeps increasing. I went with this antennae for local channels going to get ABC & CBS. We actually get 10 channels! I can't get the CBS from 112 miles away like I had hoped but I do get it from closer affiliate. Easy to put together. Hardest part was mounting. We used an existing pole & had to modify. I have already been recommending this to others who wish to "cut the cable". The picture is as clear as it was through the satellite.
customer_reviews.author: Jcnailtech

customer_reviews.title: I can get them all now!
customer_reviews.text: Had a decent omni-directional digital antenna, but from where I live there is a large angle between Boston and Providence and I want to watch stations from both cities. Now I can, amzazing amazing reception and definition. So easy to assemble and install, anyone can do it, and believe me, I don't like heights! Bought this from SUPERDEAL and am totally satisfied with price and availability, shipping. This has improved my FREE TV over-the-air experience.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cerreto

customer_reviews.title: If they were a bit more sturdy, I'd have gotten another one
customer_reviews.text: These actually do bring in channels from up to 80 miles away. It brought in those that were 60 miles and 40 miles too. It's just quite cheaply made and has a 1 or 2 year life before having to replace it. Giant Ariel antennas actual work the best in rural areas and not needing as much turning, but these work pretty good for their price.
customer_reviews.author: K. Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but poor quality hardware.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the ease of putting this together and the potential range and motorized tuner but had to send this back due to defective part (coaxial cable end sheared off when I was attaching it to the antenna body - and NO I was not overly tightening it since I know that aluminum is very fragile. Also the black rubber protective sheath was almost impossible to get over the cable's end. I have returned this and did not get to even test it as to whether or not it would actually pull in my TV stations.
customer_reviews.author: batyahTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Decent buy at $35.
customer_reviews.text: All plastic and aluminum. Pretty flimsy, but it works well. Use 3/4" EMT as a pole. 1" EMT is just a hair too large to mount in the rotator. Coax is also low quality, but it works. I get 2 more channels than previous with indoor antennas. Picture is very clear. Having the indoor power box on may not be necessary unless some of your channels require the booster to pick up or you want to rotate the antenna. Overall, a decent buy at $35.
customer_reviews.author: airtight_python

customer_reviews.title: Even Better
customer_reviews.text: I bought the older model almost 5 yrs ago, and 2 weeks ago it quit working. Not a bad investment for a quality product! I've tried other antennas and only picked up 9-12 channels, the older model gave me 19 channels, but with this one I receive 26-32!! Very Pleased with this!!!! Much cheaper than cable!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan in Iowa

customer_reviews.title: 150 mile range, Ha ha
customer_reviews.text: "150 mile range" Not hardly. I have my antenna on a pole attached to the top of my house, it is approximately 20ft off the ground. I live within 65 miles of several tv stations. According to an online antenna guide, I should be able to get around 25 channels, I get 6. A booster dose not help. It interferes with the power for the antenna, and I get no signal at all. I get the same channels from a home made coat hanger antenna, $5.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BAD! BEWARE OF LIES!
customer_reviews.text: this is not a 150 mile antenna. more like a 35 to 40 miles. I had to take this thing in town and hang it on my main house hook tablo to it then watch all my shows online. great for tablo! I am trying another antenna out later. not this brand! the only reason I gave it 2 stars, because it does work. they are lying about 150 miles. I should of guessed that they are lairs! seems like everyone lies about there product. Amazon needs to band people like them off here.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry NAFC

customer_reviews.title: It works ok
customer_reviews.text: So cheaply made. Lots of plastic. It works okay but for my application I would NOT buy it again regardless of the price. 150 miles - NOT. If you have an absolute clear sky in the direction of the broadcast station then probably. It does somewhat better than my $10.00 paper thin indoor antenna. The antenna rotator is flakey and there is no indication of what direction your pointing except the channel your trying to tune in.
customer_reviews.author: The Rabbit Whisperer

customer_reviews.title: Best antenna yet:8 compared. Will look no further.
customer_reviews.text: Better, 100% v 66% signal strength, than the multidirectional lava antenna ($80) more channels as a result. Didn't expect it to be more multidirectional. Pulling in tv from 56 miles away, across LI Sound from Connecticut. Nyc is 66 mi away. It didn't work during initial setup, but i think it will. Rotor works, seems cheap but nice feature. Your nuts if you expect to use rotor all the time on a $38 antenna. Tape red led, so you don't see it at night. Btw 4k tvmay be here in 2018, 25% stronger signal with ota video on demand: atsc3.0.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a minimal investment
customer_reviews.text: This is fabulous, once we put it on roof and not the attic.. but it pulls in the local channels I want so it's bye bye to my satellite!! Not bad for a minimal investment. I think satellite/cable companies will so be out of business. With all we have available antenna for locals Netflix, Hulu, sling tv, you can get your TV for fraction what they charge
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: I was amazed of all the stations I received
customer_reviews.text: I receive my antenna, installed it immediately. I was amazed of all the stations I received. Cancelled Cox cable right away. This antenna will save me some bucks. So I use the antenna mainly for my local channels and a few others and also stream. I am a happy customer. The only problem I have is when the antenna is off the pole it rotates, but when it's on the pole it does not rotate. I need to contact the company and figure how to fix that problem. All in all, it a great buy👍
customer_reviews.author: Hummenalong

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my in-laws
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my in-laws when they wanted to cut the cord and get rid of their satellite provider. Easy to install and get setup, even with me putting it up outside their house. We are ~50 from a major metropolitan area and this little guy picks up a very nice array of channels. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bloomfield

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: My in-laws live next door and a few years ago we spent $200 on a setup for them at Best Buy. They were happy to get 10 channels. Yesterday my father-in-law put this together and tried it at their house before installing it on our roof. He was able to get 17 channels from one direction and pick up 3 channels from 2 other states when rotating it. I can't ask for more especially at this price. We double checked his antenna last night after playing with ours and they still only got 10 channels.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: From 3 channels to 18!
customer_reviews.text: I think I'd give it 4.5 stars if it let me. I bought the same price indoor antenna and got 3 channels. I bought this and now have about 18 channels. It was easy for me to install because I already had a pole on my house, I just placed it on top of that. The remote doesn't always seem to make the antenna move but I rarely need to move it (hence the 1/2 star loss). If I paid $100 for this it would have gotten 3 stars but at $35 it gets 5. If you don't want to spend a lot of money this is your choice.
customer_reviews.author: LaurenZ32

customer_reviews.title: No more cable!
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for something to replace cable TV. This antenna is perfect for us. We mounted it in the attic and, using a digital converter box, we get all our local channels and more. By using a splitter, we were able to connect 7 TVs. The channel selection varies depending on the TV, brand and age. The main difference as of now is that the TV guide leaves a lot to be desired but there is one. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Well for us it doesn't work. It get fewer stations than my standard fixed mount antenna . Were in winter here and can't get on the roof to get this down to put our old one up. We have trees here in our neighborhood however the old antenna had fewer problems. I would pass this up.
customer_reviews.author: Jastron

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness the kids can now watch TV!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these antennae...one for our travel trailer and one for a relative as a gift. We both have property in an unincorporated area with a lot of very tall pines but these antennae do a great job mounted on 20 ft poles. We love the remote adjustment. The pictures are very clear and sharp. They pick up the ABC affiliate from 105 miles away and the CBS affiliate from 25 miles away with several other channels (CW, PBS, etc) from ranges between those.
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn Bell

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent antenna. It is easy to set up and pulls in 57 channels clearly, whereas the previous antenna only gave me 17 and some of those not well. I am very pleased with it and very highly recommend it. It does a fantastic job of pulling in those tv stations that were on the fringe of my reception area. Very clear, sharp inages, no weather or sunrise/sunset reception problems, and it has performed equally well during stormy weather. No problems, very pleased. Highly recommend to anyone seeking to improve their tv reception.
customer_reviews.author: game player

customer_reviews.title: Works really good.
customer_reviews.text: The intense sun we have here is not good for any plastic parts so I put this unit inside the attic near the gable end. Brings in about 72 channels over the air, not the best channels like cable, but free channels---major networks, pbs, some shopping, Spanish stations, religious screaming channels, etc,. I don't watch TV but mother, in her 80's, enjoys a channel from Tucson that has old westerns like Gunsmoke and the antenna brings it in good. It installed pretty easily and have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: zamzam1

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Reasonably Priced
customer_reviews.text: This outdoor antenna is small and unassuming. When you set it up and utilize the included signal amplifier, it goes to work! I mounted my antenna outside here in Brooklyn NY. I had expected to retrieve perhaps 30 broadcast channels but upon doing a channel search and setup on my TV, I found about 80 altogether! Granted, many of these channels may not be uesful to everyone (shopping, government, foreign language), but for the price, this antenna brought in the signal!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, after installing it the light went out on ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good,after installing it the light went out on the antenna.I called the tech support he said use the white cable it came with.After switching the cable it worked great,this is my third antenna best signal quality,some stations had a weak signal but I used the rotor and bam 100% signal.Its light weight and small reminds me of something out of a 50's scfi movie.Would recommend it especially for the price.Live 35 miles southeast of Chicago and have 5 tvs hooked up all have great signals.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: This is able to get a good clear picture but the motor did not work so ...
customer_reviews.text: This is able to get a good clear picture but the motor did not work so I had to move it manually. I left a message to the company and they just sent me a new one without even calling back. I hope this one works like it is supposed to. I think its awesome I was sent a new replacement but would have been better if I knew it was coming because I was wondering why they didn't return my call. I'm going to hook this up and see how it works.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L.

customer_reviews.title: Huge fine if I didn't take their adapter
customer_reviews.text: WARNING!!! Bought this antennea, does an okay job.HOWEVER!!! Had the FCC people at my house, telling me my antenna was causing calls to drop in my area, Huge fine if I didn't take their adapter, given to me, and put it on. Any device obstructing 911 calls which cause trouble for your household. Applied the adapter.... lost the channels we watch regularly! Manufactures should not be able to sell something like that, that will get you into hot water!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine on the Island!
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews, including the negative ones, (which only led to more confusion) but went with the best seller - as this was rated. And I'm glad I did... This powerful little digital antenna works with my stronger channels even without being turned on! If I turn it on - it picks up medium strength signals, as well as weaker ones, depending on conditions and direction. The best part is the HD quality, which I didn't even get with satellite TV !
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: We love, love
customer_reviews.text: We love, love, love this antenna!!! Has allowed us to unplug from cable! We get NBC, CBS, ABC and many others clear as a bell. Maybe 30+ channels in all. For free!!!! Easy to install. We mounted ours inside of our attic on the trusses. We can adjust the direction with the remote from the comfort of our couch. . Amazing!!! All I really wanted was to be able to watch the news as we stream most of our TV viewing content. Now we get major channels for free.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Not what they say.
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely going back...It is very cheaply made and there is no way it's 150 miles. I live smack in the middle of 2 major cities, about 65 miles to each. I can't get anything more than 4 channels, I was never a big PBS fan. The only thing left to try is get it at the FCC ceiling of 40', it won't last in the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Brunette

customer_reviews.title: Was good at first....but a year later.....
customer_reviews.text: So, at first I loved this thing. I got over 60 channels with it. I mounted it on my houses chimney and I live like 30 - 40 miles from all the stations. Ive had it on my roof for a year now and the most channels I get now are 8 and they are pixelated. Those 8 channels come from 2 stations (ABC has 4 and WADL has 4). Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Turcsak

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is a very inexpensive steerable antenna. My remote control lasted one session. Steering using the console lasted two sessions. It's pretty useless anyhow, in my opinion, since the remote is line-of-sight only, and the console has to be outside on our RV, because that's where the antenna connection is. The signal amplifier does still work after a month, but my hopes are low now.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: The antenna's been up for almost three weeks and so far I am completely satisfied. I would highly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: This antenna is doing exactly what I needed. We are picking up 21 channels and with the dual TV capability on the power supply, I'm able to get all my local channels and then some on both the upstairs and downstairs TV's. With the addition of this antenna and subscribing to Sling, we've been able to discontinue Direct TV which was costing far more than what we were getting out of it. Add to that that both TV's have Roku's we have more TV options now than we'll ever need at a fraction of what we were paying. The antenna's been up for almost three weeks and so far I am completely satisfied. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R Crider

customer_reviews.title: I like the fact that it has a rotor in that ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried a different 150 mile range antenna first and this one added 3 more stations. I am surrounded by high pine trees and didn't expect more reception capability. I like the fact that it has a rotor in that I am still playing with position to gain an additional channel. I had hoped for some additional info on the rotation capabilities such as how much it turns and an explanation of the buttons and lights. I figured them out by trial and error.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Kinyon

customer_reviews.title: Received when promised. I assembled with no problem but ...
customer_reviews.text: Received when promised. I assembled with no problem but could not get the TV channels to come in still. Turns out I had to buy a converter box to get the only 4 local channels to come in down at the Lake of the Ozarks. So no fault to the antenna because apparently the channels were scrambled one day in this town. Returned the antenna with no issue. Received a credit within 1 day which is long gone because I ordered other products.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent signal capture & good features. Best value for what seems to be a common antenna used in kits I've seen
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well on signals over 70 miles away. It's unusual for a product like this to have a power rotator. Excellent signal strength, but narrow bandwidth made it difficult to peak signal sources fairly far apart. The rotator has two issues: you have no readout of the direction and movement was very coarse and a bit unpredictable. Seems a bit fragile - will see what happens w/ 75 mph winds later this year.
customer_reviews.author: Smerdley

customer_reviews.title: you're looking for the perfect one this is it
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an antenna for Digital Network TV reception oh, this is the one to get. I hit stations from Metro over 200 miles away north of me and over 150 fifty miles south of me. If you're considering getting the antenna that attaches to inside your house on your wall trust me those don't work as good as this does!
customer_reviews.author: laydej

customer_reviews.title: Worked great... for a month
customer_reviews.text: It was rather easy to install, but you really got to feel how cheap the build was. At first, everything was coming in great. But after a few weeks, only about thee stations were coming in clear. Ended up getting an RCA, and it works marvelously.
customer_reviews.author: JAPWeber

customer_reviews.title: best antenna
customer_reviews.text: This is the only powered rotating outdoor antenna that works. I have been using an antenna for around 6 years none lasted long or worked good until I bought this antenna. I have one that has been hooked up since July 2016 antennaweb.org says there are 14 channels I can get in my area I’m picking up 22 channels. It will hook to more than 1 television purchased another one to hook to the second T.V. set so different channels can be watched with the best reception.
customer_reviews.author: howie midkiff

customer_reviews.title: Great Antenna - Don't buy the "Amazon Recommended extension Pole"
customer_reviews.text: The Antenna works great, it came recommended by a friend. However the "Amazon Recommended" Threesome (Antenna, Extension Pole, Base), the Pole DOES NOT FIT the antenna! You will have to buy an adapter. Be very careful with the ID/OD diameters of the attachment point of the antenna and any pole you buy. The extension pole recommended by Amazon is just a bit too large for the Antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy A Roaix

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep channels
customer_reviews.text: We purchased for two homes. Both homes had experience the same problems with not holding main channels. One day Channel 9 will be working fine and then it's gone from the list. We rotate the antenna and it might come in. We get about 60 channels.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: High def for sure
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought an Esky antenna exactly like this. I mean exact. I think it's a generic antenna that sellers are able to slap a name on, but that doesn't change the fact that my signal went from 480 resolution to 1080i on most channels in my area. Hooked it to the end of a 3/4" piece of ridged conduit and popped that into a tripod antenna mount on my deck. Once the tundra I live in thaws out for spring I'll probably double the height because the night I installed we had a very windy blizzard and it just sat locked on there like it was glued on.
customer_reviews.author: Tobias Wolf

product_meta.title: ViewTV UPGRADED 2020 Version Outdoor Amplified Digital HDTV Antenna - up to 150 Mile Range - Motorized 360° Rotation - New Wireless Remote Control - Free Mini Indoor Antenna
product_meta.description:
ViewTV Outdoor Amplified Antenna - 150 Miles Range - 360° Rotation - Wireless Remote 

Have a television with a tuner or a digital converter box and want all of those FREE channels? This is the antenna for you! 

Features: 

Built-in Low-Noise and High Gain Amplifier 
Built-in motor turns the antenna 360 degrees | Motor turns in both directions to avoid tangles 
Wireless remote controller 
Control Box with Dual TV Outputs is included 
Assembles in minutes 
Mounts to a pole up to 1" in diameter (pole not included) 
Recommended to be mounted 30 feet above ground 

Specifications: 

Working Frequency: VHF 40~300MHz | UHF 470~890MHz 
Noise Figure: <=2.5dB 
Typical Antenna Gain: VHF 28~32dB | UHF 32~36dB 
Reception Range: 150 Miles 
Channels: 1~69 
Impedance: 75Ohm 
Max Output Level:105dB u V 
Main Voltage: AC-110V/60Hz 
Operation Temperature: -10° C ~ 50° C 
Coaxial Cable Length: 12M 
Dimension: 460*90*280MM 

Actual range may vary and is highly dependent on your location. Addresses in valleys or areas with large obstructions such as mountains, buildings, etc will reduce effective range. 

Mounting pole not included - Put B01CKBFBC8 into Amazon search box for pole
feature_bullets: ANTENNA (POLE NOT INCLUDED) - 150 Miles Range| Receive free digital broadcast High Definition TV signals | Full HDTV Support: 720p, 1080i, 1080p
WORKING FREQUENCY: VHF 40~300MHz | UHF 470~890MHz | Wireless remote controller
DUAL TV OUTPUTS - This outdoor TV antenna supports 2 televisions at the same time. NO NEED FOR A SPLITTER, SPECIAL ADAPTER, OR ANOTHER HDTV ANTENNA!

WEATHER RESISTANT - Made from durable plastic and anodized aluminum, our antenna has improved weather resistance. Watch Your Favorite Channels For Free Including Events Such As The FIFA World Cup, Olympic Games & Much More.

IN THE BOX - FREE bonus mini indoor antenna! ViewTV outdoor TV antenna, wireless remote, power supply adapter, and 40 ft coax cable. Together with a 60 days money back, 1 Year Guarantee. You also get access to our friendly easy to reach support team!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars4,713 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
